intro: Threlkeldia proceriflora, commonly known as the slender-leafed threlkeldia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the wet tropical forests of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia, and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Threlkeldia proceriflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
